- Next arrow: (edited)
Inside the Imperial Palace, at the base of the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy.
Fujiwara-no-Michinaga, apparently uninjured, addresses Ashiya Douman — or rather, Limbo. (edited)
Michinaga smiles, noting that it seems as if Limbo's plans aren't going smoothly.
He gives that the warriors of the Genji have done well to obstruct Limbo from acquiring the final three souls required for the completion of the youki (妖樹, tree natured of "you," per "youkai").
Limbo acknowledges Michinaga's statement, but gives that it would be a second- or third-rate that becomes anxious at such a juncture. Being as his objective is to become as a first-rate — he who is as an Alter-Ego; as a High Servant is unmoved.
Douman: "Know you of the Kijin (鬼神, lit. "oni god") that stand at either side of me?"
"The Kijin at my right is as the Dai-Shogun (大将軍, "great general"), Ītzpāpālōtl."
"The Kijin at my left is as the Daionjin (太陰神), Chernobog."
"These would be as two amongst what are as assimilated to this humble monk become as a High Servant — the bunrei of Gods of Darkness (暗黒神)!" (edited)
"The soul of Oubanjin, Ashiya Douman is as inclusive of these two souls!"
"Already —"
"They are as consumed unto the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy — the Hell-Realm Mandala. Ee, ee."
Michinaga: "!"
"You ..."
"That you would while being as of the vessel of a man consume a god — insolent one." (edited)
Douman acknowledges that the flesh of a human could certainly not permit the realization of such a thing.
Likewise, there isn't a personality that could weather the volume of information that exists as of a Divine Spirit.
Douman: "But do not worry after me!"
"The personality and psyche of this humble monk have long been converted to spell protocols!"
"Ergo, it is even possible that I split myself into shikigami!"
"Maa, on account of assorted circumstances, all that remains of me is this primary corpus, but ..." (edited)
"... at present, even this primary corpus is as nothing more than a higher-order spell protocol (上位の術式, joui no jutsushiki)."
Michinaga calls him a foolish man — comparing him to a kidnapper who would after killing his victim tell her parents that "if you follow my instructions, your daughter will be safe." (edited)
Douman gives that Michinaga is addressing him by the wrong name. He should be called not as "Ashiya Douman," but as "Alter-Ego Limbo." (edited)
However, so saying, he immediately changes his mind, giving that he should instead by called as "Oubanjin (黄幡神), Ashiya Douman."
He asks that Michinaga leisurely observe as he ends the World of Heian (平安の世, heian no yo), and recreates it in his own image.
He gives that per the lawless wretch that he is, he'll here accelerate his plans.
More substantially, he'll be initiating the blooming of the Tree.
Douman: "This be one amongst the techniques bestowed by Satan Becometh As Lucifero — the God of an Alien Star what once summoned this humble monk —"
"For the Tree of Fantasy, a Ritual of Nurturing (生育の儀, sei'iki no gi)!"
"Whereas originally, a number of conditions had to fulfilled to render the nurturing of a Tree of Fantasy — nay, nay, there isn't any problem."
"To this purpose is the Holy Grail; to this purpose are the souls of Heroic Spirits."
"The souls contained as of the Sakazuki (杯, "cup") are already as seven."
"This would per the normal circumstances be as sufficient mana as to arrive upon the Root."
"That being said, there is a bit instability ..."
"I am one Servant short of fulfilling mine truest wish, but what have you? The preparations are quite sufficient."
"Thus ..."
"Distortion; warping — encroach from the ends of the sky —"
"Come."
"Come. Come!"
"Come into bloom!"
"— Subspecies Tree of Fantasy, the Hell-Realm Mandala!"
Narration:
— the black Root of Fantasy shook.
Conspicuously, a potent pulsation sounded.
Simultaneously, all of the crystalline bodies that comprised the youki groaned in discord.
By the consumption of the souls of the Seven Heroic Spirits sacrificed to it, the Hell-Realm Mandala now came to bloom.
— a Curse unto the World burst forth, coming into bloom.
— a cry as to altogether trample the Human Order roared forth. (edited)
Behold. It is this that is as the great blossom of evil.
Presently, an impossible apocrypha / if is spread as unto the fullness of bloom.
Hear well. It is this that is as the culmination of this wicked plot.
Presently, there comes an oppressive, maddened howl that opens the way unto a new hour. (edited)
The thousand years of promised peace (平安, heian) was but a lie. That what would come was as a causality horizon (因果地平, inga chihei) —
A Hell that would persist unto the moment of the star's annihilation!
Avīci (阿鼻, abi; a Buddhist hell) Raurava (叫喚, kyoukan; a Buddhist hell), where forever persist the groans of hatred; grief; wrath; and envy! (edited)

With this, the Gates of Hell are opened.

fallacies 14-Dec-20 04:18 PM
On the streets of Heian-Kyo, a small girl gazes up at the sky, asking where the Moon went. What she sees instead is the black thing overhead, and she wonders what it is. (edited)
A woman tells her that that isn't the Moon; that it's the Sun gone mad.
The woman tells the girl to get to safety, as only a little while prior, a vast brigade of oni were sighted.
The girl asks the woman if she's scared.
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/677174074111295489/787957430755000330/Screenshot_20201214-152547999.jpg
The woman initially puts up a strong front, but quickly gives that she's indeed quite scared.
She thinks that perhaps the bizarre state of the sky implies that the Utsushiyo (現世, "manifest world") is about to be destroyed.
The girl tells her not to be afraid.
Even that the sky has become like this, it isn't scary, because the Miyako is filled with strong warriors; and the Genji and the police.
Also, because Kin-chan is around.

At Novum Chaldea, an alarm sounds.
Sion gives that as of the Singularity, all of the parameters under observation have abruptly exhibited irregularities. (edited)
She gives that it would appear that some manner of aberration has instantiated.
The instantiation of such is situated just north of the Gate of Suzaku — come of the same source as the escalated output of aberrant mana previously observed.
da Vinci notes that the SHEBA is at present as of normal operational boundaries.
Confirming Sion's report, she gives that it wasn't an error of the observational apparatus.
da Vinci orders that resources devoted to the calculations for Proof of Existence (存在証明, sonzai shoumei) should be maintained at maximum capacity.
Presuming that the instantiation of the aberrant mana earlier observed came of the manifestation of a Tree of Fantasy, da Vinci gives the present circumstance would undoubtedly be as —

She isn't the sort of existence that one can do anything about while being as of human flesh.

In the Avenue of Suzaku, Danzou reports that the pressure rendered by way of ultra-high density mana is deescalating.
The Divine presence that binds the party here is somewhat oscillating.
She calls for Kintoki to counteract it. Hearing this, Kintoki releases a lightning strike, which neutralizes the pressure.
Asked by Tsuna if she's alright, Medea reports that she's fine.
Nursery Rhyme gives the same to Raikou, though it appears that she's sustained some damage.
Kintoki helps Guda to her feet.
Here, Danzou gives that one amongst the Hasshoushin has crossed through the Gates of Suzaku — and already, the Tree of Fantasy has come to bloom.
She isn't certain as to whether the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy is indeed truly complete, but posits that the likelihood that Limbo's plot is as of its final stage.
She isn't certain if this would imply their defeat.
fallacies 15-Dec-20 02:11 PM

Kintoki: "That being the case, let's see our will to realization!"
"Merely advance! Ain't that right?"
Guda nods.

"This is the hour that the warriors of the Genji must as a whole advance!"
Tsuna: "... it's as he says."

"Please forget that I said anything."

Ibaraki is still buried to her knees (?) in soil, but appears to be conscious. Noting this, Shuten lifts her out of the ground. (edited)

Kintoki: "Heh. It's nothing to be anxious about."
Ibaraki: "!?"
"H- How can you laugh like that, idiot!? Before that Divine presence of hers, what can you even do ... !?"
Kintoki: "Committing everything I have, I was properly and completely defeated. I've now lost once to Ibuki-Douji."
"Aah, indeed. I've lost. It was a massive defeat."
"But precisely on this account!"
At the force of Kintoki's exclamation, Ibaraki is shaken. However, about them, Shuten, Tsuna, and Raikou nod in agreement.
Kintoki: "A warrior of the Genji doesn't lose twice."
"Therefore, the next time, I'll win."
"That's all! There ain't an elaborate strategy, or anything like that, idiot!" (edited)
Ibaraki: "You're saying outright that you don't even have a strategy!? I- I- Idiot! — Shuten, there's an idiot before us!"
Shuten: "Fufu. Maa, warriors are all a bit like this, no?"
Danzou notices something.
Danzou: "Everyone! Up in the sky!"
Tsuna draws his blade.
Tsuna: "Hou. It seems that something here descends. Caster."
Medea: "A potent mana signature approaches, released from a branch of the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy. Without deviation, it's approaching this location in a straight line!" (edited)
"It isn't in singular. One, two, three —"
Raikou: "An attempt to stay our advance even now ... ? Perhaps the plot of the gedou called as Limbo isn't yet completed?"
"In that case, there's still a chance for victory! Everyone!"
"Break past this obstruction that presently comes at us, and quickly advance to the Gates of Suzaku!"
The obstruction lands before the party.
Guda: "Seeds of the Tree of Fantasy!"
Kintoki: "Heh. Are these guys strong?"
Guda: "They aren't weak — but we have to break past them and get to the Gates of Suzaku as soon as possible."
Kintoki: "Understood. Let's beat 'em up, Taishou!"

"And thereon, the Imo no Chikara (妹の力; anthropologically, a Cursecraft of Ancient Japan founded in the spiritual power women were said to bear, and not in fact the power of imouto) what aids the Heroes, and ..." https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A6%B9%E3%81%AE%E5%8A%9B (edited)
"The Master of the embers of the Greater History what is as Chaldea, hm ... "
"That you would here to such an extent tear asunder mine primary corpus as well!"
"I cannot but here retire! Ee, ee! Nnnn, a good battle, that was!"
"Well done!"
Privately, in his own thoughts, Douman gives:
"Or so I'm saying" (edited)
"But this Rasetsu-Ou won't simply die!"
fallacies 16-Dec-20 10:47 PM
"Ku, kuku, ku — the most profound mysteries of Senjutsu (仙術, "sage arts"), imparted as of Ryoujyusen (霊鷲山, lit. "mountain of the spirit eagle"; Gádhrakúta) in Tenjiku (天竺, "India") by the Houdou-Sennin (法道仙人)."

"Aah, truly ..." (edited)

fallacies 17-Dec-20 03:01 PM
Chapter 16 / Epilogue
The Miyako in daytime.
Narration:
And thereon —
The Sun what had been stained in darkness reclaimed its brilliance, and the sky did likewise.
The youki what had towered over the Heian-no-Miyaka did vanish unto light.
It's said that the man who pretended the title of Rasetsu-Ou dispersed.
Though the Imperial Palace had all but been engulfed in the youki, as of its vanishing, there was hardly any damage; and the nobles taken hostage were likewise uninjured — delivered to safety by the hand of Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu and her Four Heavenly Kings.
Exceedingly pleased that those what had defended the Miyako were none other than the Genji, who were as his stewards, it's said that the Minister of the Left, Fujiwara-no-Michinaga praised them passionately before the Mikado.
... such a tenacious man.
Truly.
Even that he were to stumble, he wouldn't be satisfied merely again to rise.
But the people who live as of the Miyako are every one of them tenacious.
Immediately after the skies reverted to normal, the markets were opened, and all proceeded per business as usual until nightfall.
The people were grateful that per the direction of the Minister of the Left and the authority of the Mikado, the great kai'i that had this time come to assail the Miyako was suppressed.
And unwavering, Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu and her men fulfilled their duties in the defense of the Miyako.
And as for me, things haven't since the day before much improved —
Thusly, I wield my brush.
— an excerpt from an unknown diary belonging to Murasaki Shikibu.
-
In a corridor of the Palace, Takako greets the Minister of the Left, giving that he looks quite well today. (edited)
Noting that the Mikado worries after him as well, she praises him for his courage in individually confronting the villain who took the Palace hostage.
Michinaga gives that he's thankful above all that the Mikado was uninjured; that whereas he himself is expendable, the Mikado is not. (edited)
At this, Takako teases him.
"Maa, well spoken, you tanuki."
fallacies 17-Dec-20 03:49 PM
"As expected of that what climbed to the top as of this Palace wherein Chimi-Mouryou (魑魅魍魎; "all manner of monsters") spend their days plotting away (権謀術数, kenbou shussuu, lit. "plots of authority exist in multiplicity")." (edited)
Michinaga: "Haha. A tanuki would lose face if so praised by a kitsune."
Takako seems shaken, and makes a strange noise.
Takako: "Bufuh."
Michinaga seems confused.
Michinaga: "Is there something wrong, Takako-dono. Ah, yes. I suppose that the comparison to a kitsune was a bit lacking in respect on my part."
Takako: "N- No, it's fine. It was I who inappropriately compared you to a tanuki, yes?"
Michinaga: "Hahahaha. Truly, as always, Takako-dono is an amusing one."
The two of them laugh at each other.
Privately, Takako thinks:
"Though, really ..."
"The vanishing of Abe-no-Seimei."
"The Tenran Seihai Sensou."
"Being as events far too inconceivable had come to occur, I thought to poke my head into the matter ..."
"I witnessed something amusing."
"Even that it merely be a dream of sea-foam (泡沫, utakata), ee. It was quite enjoyable."
"... if someday, when I perhaps truly put forth my face, I wonder what I might encounter?"
Michinaga: "N —"
Takako: "Ah, it's nothing. Fufufufu!"

Elsewhere, on a garden pathway.

"The youki suddenly split in two! And just like that, it disintegrated and turned to glittering dust."
"The black sun vanished, and the sky reverted to the way it normally looks."
"But everyone saw that, yeah? For the time being, it's the talk of the town."
"... n~."
"Still, to Seiko-san."
"The talk of the steel monstrosity that nightly stalks the avenues is better."
"Naante, ne!"
-
In the mansion of the Genji, Shuten-Douji is present.
Shuten: "N~~~~."
"Puha."
"Ah, tasty, tasty. This wine is excellent."
"To sakenonde (酒呑んで, sake-nonde, lit. "to swallow sake"; cf. 酒呑, shuten) in such a place as of daylight — fufu, it feels quite strange. Though, I'll be leaving shortly."
"Being as the youki's vanished away, and that Ibuki-something-or-other is gone as well, our truce is well concluded, and I likewise haven't the intent to stay at length."
"But — maa, given the rare opportunity, I'll stay until I've drunk my fill and exhausted the sake offered up by the manse of the Genji." (edited)
"Naa, how about you?"
fallacies 17-Dec-20 04:54 PM
Guda: "Seems like you didn't speak much with Ibuki-Douji.
Shuten gives that it's fine.
However, she gives that if summoning had gone a bit differently, perhaps what came forth might've been Shuten herself, except a bit taller, and a bit more friendly.

Shuten: "That's no good."

"N, mou. I'm a good woman as well, you know? Should I perhaps twist your neck off?"
"N?"
"Aah, it's fine that you don't be afraid. That was a joke just now."

"Those eyes."

"You who even having become an adult never lost the heart of a child."
"I'm happy that I was able to meet you."
"Many are those who drifted away from us, but ..."
"Those who come to remember have unto the next child spoken of us." (edited)
"And by this speaking; by such an encounter, even that my own thoughts come to vanish, as of the Throne, these are recorded as in the manner of a book." (edited)
"But, Raikou."
"Forever and ever shall we be friends. That alone is absolutely certain."
"However far you travel; however many blossoms of blood do come by your hand to bloom, we shall be friends — little one who always cries at the reaches of a far-off kingdom."
"You who in truth desire to hurt nobody — who desires to become as friends even to the ghosts and oni."
"— goodbye, kindly Monjyumaru."
Nursery Rhyme vanishes away.
Alone, Raikou smiles. Raikou: "... goodbye, my friend / Nursery Rhyme."
-
Tsuna: "That you would ask nothing of reward — you're truly free of desire."
"Even that you cannot bring it with you unto the Throne, it's fine that you enjoy a taste of fine sake."

"And I ..." (edited)
Medea: "That would be on account of ..." (edited)
"The strictures that I abide by in the capacity of a Servant."
"Heroic Spirits so summoned forth are such a manner of existence."

Medea: "Perhaps that's the case. However ..."
"I take pride in the matter that I was of aid to you. There is no falsehood in this sentiment."
"This Heian-Kyo; this thousand-year Miyako — we were able to preserve it against a terrible fate."
"To I who be a Heroic Spirit borne of blood-drenched past, this was happily an unexpected outcome. Truthfully." (edited)
"By the way, Tsuna-sama."
Tsuna has apparently taken note of Ibaraki.
Tsuna: "Aah."

Medea: "Umm, is it fine that we leave her be?"
Tsuna: "N."
"It's fine. I am after all quite tired, having expended myself in the preservation of the Miyako."
"And an oni absent of killing intent is much alike a dog or cat come to brush themselves against one's legs."
"That besides, this be the hour of our parting. Let her do as she wishes."
Medea smiles.
Medea: "Tsuna-sama. Could I ask you just a single question?"
Tsuna: "Aah."

Medea: "Is there perhaps some manner of history between that lady and Ibaraki-Douji?"
2
"Somewhere within the gaze that you direct upon here, I feel as if there exists a warmth as unto a fragment of something once lost; which you once held with affection."
"That was the feeling I got —"
Tsuna: "Truly, you're a perceptive woman."
Medea: "That's ..."
Her body starts to disintegrate.
Medea: "... I apologize, Tsuna-sama. It appears that my time has come."
Tsuna: "It can't be helped. Or rather."
"Goodbye. I bid that you stay in health, Caster."
Medea (smiling): "You jest. In any case, I return to the Throne."
"And with the vanishing of this temporary corpus; the return of my soul to the Throne, all the happenings of the present World —" (edited)
Ibaraki backs away.

"Silhouettes are as capable of meeting with other silhouettes, no? As in the circumstance of the Tenran Grail War this time around."

"It's fine that you merely act in accordance to you will."
"For a woman of your like — what, there's nothing to be anxious about."
"Your wisg shall certainly be granted. I guarantee it."

Medea vanishes away.

Murasaki departs.

"Therefore —"
"Protect your World. I'll be protecting my World / everyone as well!"
"Fight on!"
-
And thereon —
There was upon a mountain a single silhouette that gazed down upon Heian-Kyo.
Before the Miyako what had reclaimed its bustle — arriving as of the realization that this all had come within an inch of loss; at a horror at the foolishness that he himself had prosecuted — there was there a man who cried; who trembled in the knowledge of his sin.
The man's name was Ashiya Douman.
4
He was as the houshi-onmyouji (法師陰陽師, "priest and onmyouji") not become as Alter-Ego Limbo.
With the bisection and the fading unto light of the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy that was the Hell-Realm Mandala —come forth from the shattered Saint Graph and the Spiritual Core of Limbo, he was of a flesh that had by some means miraculously restored to life.
Once he came to, he was here in this place, crying as he stood.
Wiping the corners of his eyes, he murmured, absent of any strength —
Douman: "... this humble monk is."
"This humble is as a horrific being. Even that I be liberated, I feel the Curse within me."
"Shall I someday in such a manner be reduced as unto an akki (悪鬼, lit. "evil oni")?"
"To take precisely in the suffering of all that live an incomparable pleasure ..." (edited)
"Shall I arrive unto the very summit of gedou? If that be the case; if that be the case."
"I haven't a need for what lies beyond tomorrow."
"Upon this day and in this hour, there be no path but to sever my own karma —"
Somebody approaches him from behind.
fallacies 17-Dec-20 09:58 PM
Voice: "Suicide, hm? Being as you're a man once acquired (修めた, osameta, "mastered") of the highest mystery (奥義, ougi) of the men of path (道人, doujin), you're being unreasonable." (edited)
"Cease in this pointlessness, Ashiya Douman."
Douman: "Seimei-dono ... To think that you'd returned to the Miyako."
"Or perhaps — I see; the claim that you'd concealed yourself was false. Did you perhaps see through everything from the start?" (edited)
"If that be; if that be, per the indiscretion that this humble monk has so committed, why would you here call for me to cease ... ?"
Seimei: "It isn't a matter of why or what."
"It's merely, the matter that the Ashiya Douman would fail to overcome the likes of a fragment of his own shadow was even for Abe-no-Seimei a circumstance beyond foresight — idiot." (edited)
"And, if I were to further push my critique —" (edited)
"Fixation on individuals is your flaw, Douman."
Douman: "Seimei-dono —"
-
— in the legends of the Greater History, it's said.
In a certain month of a certain year ...
The oni of Ooe who descended unto the Miyako were dissatisfied merely to steal away valuables; to kidnap women and children —
They assailed the people; began to kill and consume.
It was as an escalation of the oni. (edited)
As of the Oni-Goten at Ooe-Yama, it's said that there was a vast pit, unto which were discarded the bones of countless women and children.
Worrying after the circumstances, Abe-no-Seimei requested unto the Mikado an expedition as to suppress of the oni of Ooe.
Selected as the commander for this expedition was the acting leader of the Genji, Minamoto-no-Raikou. (edited)
Events would here connect unto the legend of the suppression of the oni at Ooe-Yama — the inception of the last great conflict between the warriors of the Heian and the oni. (edited)
In the mountains, bestowed the blessings of three Gods — Hachiman (八幡), Kumano (熊野), and Sumiyoshi (住吉) — the Four Heavenly Kings of Yorimitsu did the Ooe-no-Oyama assail. (edited)
Shuten-Douji; Ibaraki-Douji; Kanekuma-Douji (金熊童子); Kuma-Douji; Toraguma-Douji; Hoshiguma-Douji.
All the strongest of the oni were slain ...
It's said that Shuten-Douji did upon the blade of Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu vanish unto mist.
The oni did succumb to a poisoned wine — Jinben Kidoku Shu (神便鬼毒酒), what was as the aggregation of the blessings of the three gods. (edited)
fallacies 17-Dec-20 10:48 PM
Even that by the potency of this poisoned wine did Raikou and her men — disguised as Yamabushi (山伏, mountain-dwelling practitioners of Shugendou) — diminish the might of Shuten-Douji, thrown into rage did she assail the warriors before coming in the end to her own beheading. (edited)
But how is it that Shuten-Douji, well-versed as she was in wines, came to imbibe this poison?
Was it per the blessings of the three gods that she was forced to drink it? Or, perhaps ...
Did she drink it deliberately?
Nobody knows the truth.
And thereon.
Per a dissenting account, obscure and little known ...
Immediately subsequent the escalation of the oni of Ooe, it's given that moreso than prior, Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu became as a cold-blooded butcher.
Perhaps the reason was as a wrath unto the acts of the oni; or perhaps it was on account that Kintoki, who she cherished as a son, was — (edited)
Whether it be or not that she knew that he had in youth encountered Shuten, she came to call all oni as "insects" (虫, mushi), it's said. (edited)
As of this same dissenting account, it's likewise so stated.
As of the conclusion of the expedition unto Ooe-Yama, defeating Shuten who had transformed into a giant kai'i what might've been mistaken for a mount by use of an Oo-Gusoku, it was not Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu who beheaded the slumbering Shuten, reverted to her original form, but Shumenosuke Sakata-no-Kintoki himself — (edited)
And further, the one who defeated Ibaraki was ...
... Udoneri Watanabe-no-Tsuna ...
... for whatever reason, Ibaraki alone was spared.
At the site Rajoumon.
At Ichijou Modoribashi.
Again did Ibaraki assail Watanabe-no-Tsuna —
Once deprived of an arm, Ibaraki did this reclaim, and thereon vanish away, it's said.
And, sometime subsequent.
The houshi-onmyouji called as Douman Houshi (道満法師, "Douman the priest") — Ashiya Douman, did, joining forces with Fujiwara-no-Akimitsu (藤原顕光), who had in death become as the onryou (怨霊, "grudge spirit") Akuryou Safu (悪霊左府, lit. "evil spirit minister of the left"), attempt the prosecution of a grand Cursecraft (大呪術, oo-jujutsu) to the purpose of upending Japan; but he was here obstructed by Abe-no-Seimei ... (edited)
Named as a traitor, it's said that he was chased from the Miyako.
Alternatively, at the outcome of failing a number of times to prevail against Abe-no-Seimei, it's given that Douman Houshi was in the end bathed as of Juso-Kaeshi (呪詛返し, "curse backlash"), and did thereon meet his death.
But these are tales that shan't be here further spoken of.
As of the vastness of the Greater History of Man, this was merely a scene of a single instant —
-
Back in Chaldea, Mashu and Kotarou greet Guda. (edited)
Mashu performs a simple medical check, and confirms that there aren't any irregularities in Guda's vitals.
Guda tells Mashu that she's fine; that there's no need to worry.
To this, Mashu gives that what she conducted just now was only a simple medical check. She asks that immediately hereafter, Guda should head to the examination room at the infirmary, where Nemo Nurse will provide a more extensive assessment. (edited)
Mashu apologizes that she wasn't of aid this time around.
She feels bad that she wasn't able to properly rayshift.
Here, Kotarou gives that it's he who should apologize, as he wasn't able to properly deploy a countermeasure against Limbo's interference.
Danzou tells the both of them that it's nothing to be concerned about, as the incident was resolved, and Guda safely returned to Chaldea.
The Tree of Fantasy was culled, and the Grail that instantiated the Singularity was secured.
Irrelevant of circumstances, the mission was successfully completed.
If there's anyone to blame for the issues pertaining to the rayshift, it's Limbo.
Ergo, if Mashu and Kotarou have any regrets regarding this mission, they should apply themselves to the missions here on out.
Mashu and Kotarou are cheered by the pep talk.
Here, da Vinci arrives.
She gives that she's confirmed the inception of the Singularity's restoration, as well as the complete elimination of the Subspecies Tree of Fantasy.
Though the Greater History is still as of the stat of Tabula Rasa, at the very least, Guda has obstructed the instantiation of a new Lostbelt.
The circumstance whereby, even that the Human Order were restored, the Heian Era might've become as the inception of the annihilation of the Greater History — this was by Guda's efforts prevented.
da Vinci: "Truly a flawless mission!"
Guda: "Thank you, da Vinci-chan. It's mission complete, then." (edited)
da Vinci: "Being as you're twice as admirable as you usually are, I'll give you twice the headpats."
"Wonderful!"
Holmes: "It's a truly happy circumstance that you were able to defeat Alter-Ego Limbo as well."
"Even that it appears as if he wasn't acting as of unified front with the others, Limbo was as one of the three Alter-Egos in the direct service of the God of an Alien Star."
"If only in the slightest quantity, it could be said that we've whittled away at the combat potential of the opposition." (edited)
"Director Gordorf will certainly be pleased."
"Though he asked that inclusive of the time that communications were obstructed, you should within two hours of returning offer forth a written report, he is at present personally preparing a meal for your sake."
Guda: "I'll say hi to him a bit later. If he sees my report, he's bound to be angry ..."
Holmes: "Honestly, later is fine. It's more important that you rest for now." (edited)
Danzou: "Worry not. Limbo's talk of a secret bestowed to him alone by the God of an Alien Star was almost certainly meaningless nonsense."
Holmes: "Though indeed, the words spoken forth by Alter-Ego Limbo are scant of credibility —"
da Vinci: "Hai, hai. I'm stopping you right there. Her medical check comes first. After that, she rests. Got that?"
"Sorry, Mashu, but could you escort Guda?"
Mashu: "Y- Yes, certainly!"
In the corridor, Fou greets Guda.
Mashu: "Ah, Fou-san. Sorry, but as Senpai needs to rest —"
Fou: "Fou?"
Mashu: "Yes. You shouldn't bother her for now."
Kintoki: "O-to. In that case, we shouldn't talk too long, huh?"
"Yo, Taishou!"
"First, I just wanna know one thing. Naa, how was it over there with the lot of us?"
Guda: "As a matter of course,"
"it was Golden!"
Kintoki smiles.
Fou: "Fou — lden!"
